answers.answer: What do you mean by high blood pressure?  What is your reading and where are you getting it (doctor's office, at home, drug store)?Are you currently pregnant?  If so, how far along?Blood pressure needs to be monitored during pregnancy...high bp, along with other symptoms like swelling in hands and feet, protein in the urine, etc., can be a sign of preeclampsia which is quite dangerous for mother and baby.  You may have all the symptoms or just one, but it should be monitored by your doctor.  If you don't have an appointment for a while, it would be wise to give them a call to see if they'd like to see you.

Well this is my story...With my 1st son, (never had h b/p) I had some what high b/p doc was never to concern about it, she tought I might have  "the little white coat " syd.( if you know what i mean) Bu tI ended up being induce at 38w because it was so high.it took a little time, after i had my son for it to get back down to normal. and it was normal for months. hd and I TTC again, my b/p when UP and the next week I found out I was pregnant. Sadly ended in a missed m/c. after that it when back down.Now. Hb and I are TTC again, Took b/p today and its UP again, Im going to test sun-mon.I work in a dental office I use to mont. here!

What reading are you getting?Also, I think if it is pregnancy-induced hypertension it goes down pretty quickly after delivery (Peek, anyone?)...so if it took some time it may not have had anything to do with the pregnancy -- other than may have been exacerbated by it.I think I would check with your primary doctor and your ob and see what they advise.  They may want to check you out BEFORE you get pregnant.  Typically pregnancy-induced hypertension happens later in pregnancy...so give them a call and see what they advise.  It would be better to find out if this is a big concern before you get pregnant.Hope you feel better...good luck.
By reading today was like 156/86.Before today it was  126/70ish-136/70ish is would stay around these #'s

I believe the top number is the one that will go up when you are nervous, and the bottom one is the one that you can't control without medication.  I could be wrong.  I also was induce due to pre eclamsia, and my bp went down after a few weeks.  Good luck ttc!!

Im sure you know the most important number is the bottom number, which 86 isnt all that bad. Normal 120/80. I too had "white coat syndrome" while i was pregnant and had to go through like 3 or 4 of those 24 hr urine tests. But you dont say your pregnant now? YOur trying to conceive? Ive always had some what high bp and i did ok. i would try getting it down before trying to conceive cause that could cause complications.
